Blog.post: Hey everyone! We finished the first camp yesterday. Today was our "day off" and I did some work (preparing for next camp), then some of us went to LA to go to a Dogers game! It was sold out, due to the Bobble Head movement on the West Coast...can't believe it!!! So we drove down Hollywood Blvd. (what's your dream!?), and went to Chicken n' Waffles (for me it was just "Waffles"), then came back to campus. Tomorrow we realign with the staff and prepare for the next camp with starts on Sunday. The last camp was with the younger kids, ages 8-11-ish for 8 days. The next two camps are ages 11-13-ish for 10 days. Go check out the pictures if you get a chance...there are some good ones of me on Day 10. Hope all is well on the East Side! I miss you guys, fill me in on things! Talk to you soon. Sue
Let's try this again...to view picture, just like Sheryl said, switch the two...the username should be "thisisit" and password is "photos". Enjoy!!! I'm beat...

Hey all! Things are going well in Cali. A big hectic though. But I'm thinking of you guys, especially since tomorrow's the touniment! Definately post the pictures...and feel free to play my song to remember me, haha! I heard Dremos was fun...literaly, I heard it when Jeff informed me of his pee and of crazy overtime with Brett and Jules. What was the status with that? Well it's the second day campers are here. We have little ones! They're sooooo cute...and homesick. Tomorrow's Outdoor Adventure, when they go on the ropes course for the day and have a blast. I finally got to do some laundry today, it's been busy here. The people I'm working with are really great. I miss you guys! I have a picture in my room of the Llama crew all throwing a dart (no, not a softball believe it or not) at the same time hung up in my room. OK, more updates soon. P.S. If you're interested in some pictures (mostly none of me, but of the program I'm running), check out urlLink www.SuperCamp.com and click on "photos" (or the picture of the camera). The username is "photos" and the password is "thisisit".

We have to bring a wireless laptop to the tourney this weekend to keep Sue informed of our winnings.... Music, stats, and direct to CA scores, all on the Llama website. Do it quick, but not too quick.

Casey and Joe have a new puppy...beagle mix...and of course soooo cute ! Name is Scout (but we were thinking of naming her Six as she has this random extra toenail on the inside of her left or right hind leg about 1/3 of the way up the leg). AND she had her first pee since coming home from the shelter on our upstairs living room floor yesterday (at Joe and my house)!

Sue - As you're going through your exciting, tiring days out there you may just want to take a break every now and then, think of some things from home, and smile. Here's a sampling... -Mitch's Bitches -Grommet -Doing stuff to make you "laugh" -Toby getting "excited" as he rounds the bases in anticipation of his reward. -Grazing -Dearborn parties -Iiit was the pickle! -Do It! -Another S&J victory at darts -Jules knocking over beer pong cups -Jules taking the "Hey Ya" DJ -Jules -O--K--A--Y -Evite responses -Another Llamas victory

Hey all from !!! Most of you know I left on Wednesday, and I flew out of BWI. My travels were very interesting. First, I got to the airport about 6 hours early (I knowingly did this), which wasn't bad at all. You should know I was able to keep myself entertained, plenty. I got on the plane that had a layover in Houston, then from Houston to Ontario (California, not Canada). So my flight to Houston was great, I had no one sitting next to me, and next to the empty seat was a kid who was young enough to be cute and old enough to be quiet...perfect! Get on my transfer plane to Ontario...make my way to the back of the plane where I am sitting next to an obese couple. So I'm sitting half on the seat and half in the isle...for the entire 3 hours, in the back of the plane, near the bathroom, and where they prepare the food...so I'm getting bumped around the whole time. But I finally made it, and things have been crazy since I arrived (crazy good). I've met some great people I'll be working with this summer. But we're about to go to bed. Give me some stories!!! I miss you all, hope to hear from you soon. Love, Sue

so um, yeah. i can blog too. just to keep you and all of your friends updated with my life. Things are going good. I spent the last couple days in Jersey, saw a lot of cool stuff. now i'm back working, it sucks. that's my life in a nutshell. hope your friends have enjoyed this little insight... grommet bisnitch.
I'm not sure how this works but I'm signed up:-) Hope Cali is going well!!
And this one time, at band camp.... Oh wait this is super camp!
Rock on... Blogging is fun. We should all do it.
oh my god, i feel like i'm really a part of something for the first time in my life...sue, you should have sent evites to join your blog. yeah supercamp...i'm Opening The Front Door to the world.
For all of you wanting to send me any goodies (hint hint), here's the address: Sue Schultz SuperCamp - Pitzer College 1050 N. Mills Ave. Claremont, CA 91711
